member.param: A BigInteger that has been subjected to and passed trial division
member.returns: False if bi is composite, true if it may be prime.

member.summary: Generates the smallest prime >= bi
member.param: A BigInteger
member.returns: The smallest prime >= bi. More mathematically, if bi is prime: bi, else Prime [PrimePi [bi] + 1].

member.name: M:Mono.Math.BigInteger.Kernel.Multiply(System.UInt32[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: Multiplies the data in x [xOffset:xOffset+xLen] by y [yOffset:yOffset+yLen] and puts it into d [dOffset:dOffset+xLen+yLen].
member.remarks: This code is unsafe! It is the caller's responsibility to make sure that it is safe to access x [xOffset:xOffset+xLen], y [yOffset:yOffset+yLen], and d [dOffset:dOffset+xLen+yLen].

member.name: M:Mono.Math.BigInteger.Kernel.MultiplyMod2p32pmod(System.UInt32[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Multiplies the data in x [xOffset:xOffset+xLen] by y [yOffset:yOffset+yLen] and puts the low mod words into d [dOffset:dOffset+mod].
member.remarks: This code is unsafe! It is the caller's responsibility to make sure that it is safe to access x [xOffset:xOffset+xLen], y [yOffset:yOffset+yLen], and d [dOffset:dOffset+mod].

member.name: M:Org.Mentalis.Security.Cryptography.DiffieHellmanManaged.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance.
member.remarks: The default length of the shared secret is 1024 bits.

member.name: M:Org.Mentalis.Security.Cryptography.DiffieHellmanManaged.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,Org.Mentalis.Security.Cryptography.DHKeyGeneration)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance.
member.param: The length, in bits, of the public P parameter.
The length, in bits, of the secret value X. This parameter can be set to 0 to use the default size.
One of the values.
member.remarks:
The larger the bit length, the more secure the algorithm is. The default is 1024 bits. The minimum bit length is 128 bits.
The size of the private value will be one fourth of the bit length specified.
member.exception: The specified bit length is invalid.

member.name: M:Org.Mentalis.Security.Cryptography.DiffieHellmanManaged.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance.
member.param: The P parameter of the Diffie-Hellman algorithm. This is a public parameter.
The G parameter of the Diffie-Hellman algorithm. This is a public parameter.
The X parameter of the Diffie-Hellman algorithm. This is a private parameter. If this parameters is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), a secret value of the default size will be generated.
member.exception: or is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance.

The G parameter of the Diffie-Hellman algorithm.
The length, in bits, of the private value. If 0 is specified, the default value will be used.
member.exception: or is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: T:Org.Mentalis.Security.Cryptography.DHKeyGeneration
member.summary: Defines the different Diffie-Hellman key generation methods.

member.name: F:Org.Mentalis.Security.Cryptography.DHKeyGeneration.Random
member.summary: Returns dynamically generated values for P and G. Unlike the Sophie Germain or DSA key generation methods, this method does not ensure that the selected prime offers an adequate security level.

member.name: F:Org.Mentalis.Security.Cryptography.DHKeyGeneration.Static
member.summary: Returns values for P and G that are hard coded in this library. Contrary to what your intuition may tell you, using these hard coded values is perfectly safe. The values of the P and G parameters are taken from 'The OAKLEY Key Determination Protocol' [RFC2412]. This is the prefered key generation method, because it is very fast and very safe. Because this method uses fixed values for the P and G parameters, not all bit sizes are supported. The current implementation supports bit sizes of 768, 1024, 1536, and 2048.

member.name: M:Mono.Math.Prime.PrimalityTests.RabinMillerTest(Mono.Math.BigInteger,Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor)
member.summary: Probabilistic prime test based on Rabin-Miller's test

param.name: confidence
param.para: The number of chosen bases. The test has at least a 1/4^confidence chance of falsely returning True.

returns.para: True if "this" is a strong pseudoprime to randomly chosen bases.
False if "this" is definitely NOT prime.

member.name: T:Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor
member.summary: A factor of confidence.

member.name: F:Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor.ExtraLow
member.summary: Only suitable for development use, probability of failure may be greater than 1/2^20.

member.name: F:Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor.Low
member.summary: Suitable only for transactions which do not require forward secrecy. Probability of failure about 1/2^40

member.name: F:Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor.Medium
member.summary: Designed for production use. Probability of failure about 1/2^80.

member.name: F:Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor.High
member.summary: Suitable for sensitive data. Probability of failure about 1/2^160.

member.name: F:Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor.ExtraHigh
member.summary: Use only if you have lots of time! Probability of failure about 1/2^320.

member.name: F:Mono.Math.Prime.ConfidenceFactor.Provable
member.summary: Only use methods which generate provable primes. Not yet implemented.
